title: Giraflow Schema
description: A human-readable format for describing event-driven systems using Event Modeling.

timeline.description: The chronologically ordered sequence. The order in the array determines the position on the timeline from left to right.

specifications.description: Specifications for commands and state views, grouping scenarios by element name

Attachment.description: Additional information attached to a command or state view (images, links, notes, files)

path.description: Relative file path (for image and file types)

EventReference.description: A reference to an event with optional example data for scenarios

data.description: Event payload data for this scenario

CommandScenario.description: A scenario describing command behavior with context events and outcomes

steps.description: Sequence of context events and command executions

StateViewScenario.description: A Given-Then scenario describing how events project to state

name.description: Descriptive name of the scenario (e.g. 'Show available books after return')

initialState.description: The initial state before any events are processed

steps.description: Sequence of given-then steps showing state evolution

then.description: The expected state after processing this event

Event.description: An event represents something that has happened. Named in past tense (e.g. OrderPlaced, OrderShipped).

name.description: Name of the event (past tense, e.g. 'OrderPlaced')

tick.description: Logical timestamp for ordering on the timeline

producedBy.description: Reference to the command that produced this event (format: 'CommandName-Tick')

externalSource.description: For external events: the source system (e.g. 'Carrier Webhook')

system.description: System/bounded context this event belongs to (determines swimlane)

StateView.description: A state view (read model) built from events. Named as a noun (e.g. PendingOrders, CustomerProfile).

name.description: Name of the state view (noun, e.g. 'PendingOrders')

tick.description: Logical timestamp for ordering on the timeline

sourcedFrom.description: Names of the events this state view subscribes to

attachments.description: Additional information (images, links, notes, files) attached to this state view

Actor.description: An actor (human or system) that reads views and sends commands. Named as a role (e.g. WarehouseWorker, PaymentGateway).

tick.description: Logical timestamp for ordering on the timeline

readsView.description: Name of the state view that the actor reads

sendsCommand.description: Name of the command that the actor sends

wireframes.description: Wireframe HTML files for this actor's UI (relative paths within the assets folder)

role.description: Role category for grouping actors into swimlanes

Command.description: A command represents an intent to do something. Named in imperative (e.g. ShipOrder, ProcessPayment).

tick.description: Logical timestamp for ordering on the timeline

attachments.description: Additional information (images, links, notes, files) attached to this command

CommandSpecification.description: A specification grouping scenarios for a command

name.description: Name of the command this specification describes

StateSpecification.description: A specification grouping scenarios for a state view

name.description: Name of the state view this specification describes
